block.p: WARNACO INC., New York, the apparel maker, said it was closing a manufacturing plant in Ottawa, cutting 425 jobs, or 1.5 percent of its work force.
TICKETMASTER GROUP, Los Angeles, the ticketing company, owned by USA Networks, said it would dismiss 382 people when it shuts a Dallas call center.
WARNACO INC., New York, the apparel maker, said it was closing a manufacturing plant in Ottawa, cutting 425 jobs, or 1.5 percent of its work force.
TICKETMASTER GROUP, Los Angeles, the ticketing company, owned by USA Networks, said it would dismiss 382 people when it shuts a Dallas call center.
UNITED ILLUMINATING, New Haven, said its Precision Power unit had bought the closely held Orlando Diefenderfer, an electrical contractor, Allentown, Pa. Terms were not disclosed.
FEDERAL REALTY INVESTMENT TRUST, Rockville, Md., sold its Peninsula Shopping Center in Palos Verdes, Calif., to Principal Life Insurance for $48.6 million.
